meanings.definition: The act of writing one's own name
meanings.sent1: In school, we practiced autography by signing our names on the attendance sheet.
meanings.sent2: His autography was so neat and elegant that it stood out on the document.
meanings.sent3: During the autography lesson, the teacher pretended to have trouble writing her own name.
meanings.sent4: Her autography was like a work of art, each letter carefully crafted and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The importance of autography is evident when you see how a signature can authenticate a document.

meanings.definition: A signature or handwriting of a famous person
meanings.sent1: The autography of the celebrity was auctioned off for a high price.
meanings.sent2: Collectors were eager to obtain the autography of the renowned author.
meanings.sent3: The museum proudly displayed the autography of the famous painter in a special exhibit.
meanings.sent4: Her autography was so unique that it became instantly recognizable to her fans.
meanings.sent5: The value of autography from historical figures lies in its ability to connect us to the past.
